alert.note: Alert for Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:48PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Crenshaw County through 530 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Rutledge, or 7 miles northwest of Luverne. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Luverne and Rutledge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
